1{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleInstances #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | I/O point: file, standard input, direct text, etc.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Base.IO.IOPoint
7  ( -- * Named handle
8    NamedHandle (..),
9
10    -- * I/O point
11    IOPoint (..),
12    ioPointType, ioPointText,
13    ioPoint, ioPointDir, ioPointTogether,
14
15    -- * Indexed I/O point
16    IxIOPoint (..),
17    codeIxIO,
18    pathIxIO,
19  ) where
20
21import qualified System.IO                       as IO
22import qualified Data.ByteString.Lazy            as Bz
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture        as O
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.List       as B
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Prelude    as B
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.IO.BzFile  as B
27
28
29-- ============================================  Named handle
30
31-- | Named I/O handle.
32data NamedHandle = NamedHandle
33    { handleName :: String       -- ^ Name of handle
34    , handle     :: IO.Handle    -- ^ I/O handle
35    }
36
37instance Show NamedHandle where
38    show = handleName
39
40instance Eq NamedHandle where
41    h1 == h2 = handleName h1 == handleName h2
42
43instance Ord NamedHandle where
44    h1 `compare` h2 = handleName h1 `compare` handleName h2
45
46
47-- ============================================  I/O point
48
49-- | I/O point: file, standard input, direct text, etc.
50data IOPoint
51    = IOPointFile   FilePath FilePath     -- ^ __1 Input/Output:__ Context directory and target path.
52    | IOPointUri    O.IOPath              -- ^ __2 Input:__ Universal resource identifier.
53    | IOPointText   (Maybe String) B.Bytes  -- ^ __3 Input:__ Input bytes and its name.
54    | IOPointCustom String O.Bz           -- ^ __4 Input:__ Custom I/O.
55    | IOPointStdin  (Maybe String)        -- ^ __5 Input:__ The sandard input.
56    | IOPointStdout (Maybe String)        -- ^ __6 Output:__ The sandard output.
57    | IOPointOutput NamedHandle           -- ^ __7 Output:__ Output handler.
58      deriving (Show, Eq, Ord)
59
60instance O.GetIOPath IOPoint where
61    getIOPath = ioPointText
62
63-- | Name of I/O point, i.e., @\"file\"@, @\"uri\"@, @\"text\"@,
64--   @\"stdin\"@, or @\"stdout\"@.
65ioPointType :: IOPoint -> String
66ioPointType (IOPointFile   _ _)  = "file"
67ioPointType (IOPointUri    _)    = "uri"
68ioPointType (IOPointText   _ _)  = "text"
69ioPointType (IOPointCustom _ _)  = "custom"
70ioPointType (IOPointStdin  _)    = "stdin"
71ioPointType (IOPointStdout _)    = "stdout"
72ioPointType (IOPointOutput _)    = "output"
73
74-- | Name of I/O point.
75ioPointText :: IOPoint -> String
76ioPointText (IOPointFile   dir file)  = dir ++ file
77ioPointText (IOPointUri    uri)       = uri
78ioPointText (IOPointText   name _)    = B.fromMaybe "<text>" name
79ioPointText (IOPointCustom name _)    = name
80ioPointText (IOPointStdin  name)      = B.fromMaybe "<stdin>" name
81ioPointText (IOPointStdout name)      = B.fromMaybe "<stdout>" name
82ioPointText (IOPointOutput h)         = handleName h
83
84-- | Create I/O Point.
85ioPoint :: O.IOPath -> IOPoint
86ioPoint "system://stdin"    = IOPointStdin  Nothing
87ioPoint "system://stdout"   = IOPointStdout Nothing
88ioPoint path | isUri path   = IOPointUri  path
89             | otherwise    = IOPointFile "" path
90
91-- | Add context directory.
92ioPointDir :: FilePath -> O.Map IOPoint
93ioPointDir dir (IOPointFile _ path) = IOPointFile dir path
94ioPointDir _ iop = iop
95
96-- | Test path is URI.
97isUri :: O.Test O.IOPath
98isUri path = O.isPrefixOf "http://"  path
99          || O.isPrefixOf "https://" path
100          || O.isPrefixOf "ftp://"   path
101
102-- | Create I/O points from using stdin, texts itself, filenames, and URIs.
103ioPointTogether :: Bool -> [B.Bytes] -> [FilePath] -> [IOPoint]
104ioPointTogether stdin texts paths =
105    let ts = IOPointText Nothing <$> texts
106        ps = ioPoint <$> paths
107    in B.consIf stdin (IOPointStdin Nothing) $ ts ++ ps
108
109
110-- ============================================  Indexed I/O point
111
112-- | Indexed I/O point.
113data IxIOPoint = IxIOPoint
114    { nioNumber  :: O.Ix      -- ^ Index (0 for unindexed, > 0 for indexed)
115    , nioPoint   :: IOPoint   -- ^ I/O point
116    } deriving (Show)
117
118instance Eq IxIOPoint where
119    x == y  = compare x y == EQ
120
121-- | Comapre indicies if indicies are non zero,
122--   comapre I/O point if both are zero.
123instance Ord IxIOPoint where
124    x@IxIOPoint{ nioNumber = xn } `compare` y@IxIOPoint{ nioNumber = yn }
125      | xn == 0 && yn == 0  = nioPoint x `compare` nioPoint y
126      | otherwise           = xn `compare` yn
127
128-- | Zero-numbered empty input point.
129instance B.Default IxIOPoint where
130    def = codeIxIO Bz.empty
131
132instance O.GetIx IxIOPoint where
133    getIx = nioNumber
134
135instance O.GetIOPath IxIOPoint where
136    getIOPath = O.getIOPath . nioPoint
137
138-- | Create input point for given lazy bytestring.
139--
140--   >>> codeIxIO "abc"
141--   IxIOPoint {nioNumber = 0, nioPoint = IOPointText Nothing "abc"}
142--
143codeIxIO :: (B.ToBytes code) => code -> IxIOPoint
144codeIxIO = IxIOPoint 0 . IOPointText Nothing . B.toBytes
145
146-- | Create input point from file path.
147pathIxIO :: FilePath -> IxIOPoint
148pathIxIO path = IxIOPoint 0 $ IOPointFile "" path
149
